reviews.review_msg: The class can be a bit intimidating, but Naoko makes it approachable and fun. You never feel stupid, despite her offhanded remarks. Funny, approachable, and a great teacher, Naoko is among one of the best profs at SFU.

I would take her class again if you are planning to continue taking Japanese class in SFU. Although she might be a bit difficult, if you are passionate about learning Japanese language she will guide you well.

Taking Japanese with Naoko Sensei is the best decision I have ever made in SFU. She is an awesome professor, and it was actually really fun going to her classes, not just for attendance and quizzes. She has always been very caring, and she marks fairly. If you do study for quizzes and put effort into the group project, an A wouldn't be impossible.
Truly cares about what he teaches and how his student progress from his teaching. He made me feel like his main goal is to help students learn, NOT to grade them. Funny and kind
Picky and harsh. Un-organized and the classes are boring. Final exams are straight out from the textbook which seems unreasonable. Who has that much time to memorize the whole textbook word by word?
Getting easier and easier. Can get good marks without knowing anything.

Just a really sweet lady who rejuvenated my interest in learning Japanese. Shoe focuses on making the class fun, and tries to teach you not just the language, but also cultural elements as well. I learned not just Japanese, but about Japan as well. Only complaint is that she has to cancel/move move class online a lot.
Furukawa was a great prof who explained grammar and language concepts well. I'm very glad I decided to take her class!
